title: A Randomized Open-Label, Active-Controlled  Study of DMD-551 (exon-skipping antisense oligonucleotide) in Patients With Metastatic Breast Cancer
officialTitle: A Randomized Open-Label, Active-Controlled  Study of DMD-551 (exon-skipping antisense oligonucleotide) in Patients With Metastatic Breast Cancer
description: This is a randomized open-label, active-controlled  study designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of DMD-551 (exon-skipping antisense oligonucleotide) in patients with Metastatic Breast Cancer. The study will enroll approximately 429 patients.
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 24-78 years
- Confirmed diagnosis of Metastatic Breast Cancer
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate organ function
- Willing and able to provide informed consent
- Measurable disease per RECIST v1.1
- Prior treatment with standard therapy
- Life expectancy â‰¥3 months

Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to study drug or excipients
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Participation in another interventional study within 30 days
- Significant cardiovascular disease within past 6 months
- Active or chronic infection requiring systemic treatment
- Brain metastases unless treated and stable
- Prior treatment with similar mechanism of action
- Other active malignancy requiring treatment
